caption: This image depicts a close-up of a roughly oval-shaped object with a somewhat jagged and irregular outline. The object has a mottled appearance with a dominant palette of browns, grays, and hints of red and white. Its texture looks highly detailed, showing a mixture of various elements that could be organic or mineral, making it appear somewhat like a compressed or fossilized material. The background is entirely black, which starkly contrasts with the object, highlighting its intricate and varied surface details. The overall impression is that of a scientific or geological sample, perhaps a rock, mineral, or even a slice of some natural substance viewed under magnification.
title: Foamy white waste material in Mill Creek. Waste from the Calcasieu Paper Mill in Elizabeth, La., drains into the creek. The effects of pollution can be seen 30 miles south of the plant where the creek runs through a large game preserve and forest.
